pageContext.claim: “The number of police officers shot and killed in the line of duty last year, I'm so happy to report, is down 21 percent compared to the year before, and that was the year before I took office.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's narrowly tailored claim is incorrect, according to data maintained by the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund. There was a slight dip, of four percent, in the number of police officers killed in the line of duty from 2016 to 2017, Trump's first year in office. The group said 135 officers were killed in 2016, compared to 129 in 2017. But then the number of police deaths spiked 12 percent in 2018, Trump's second year in office, to 144. As for police officers shot and killed, the number fell from 64 in 2016 to 46 in 2017, but then increased to 52 in 2018.
